instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Had a guy call me today that said his macbook had stopped turning on and he had taken it to Apple to repair, They told him originally that it was a faulty logic board and quoted over Â£1000 to repair. Then whilst thet still had the mac they sent him this,.
[ATTACH]60935[/ATTACH]

I agreed to take a look for him.

The mac wont turn on at all no fan spin, nothing in SMC bypass no real signs of life but I do get trackpad click when power connected,

The usb Amp meter immediately draws 20v and shows enough Amps to presume its charging the battery on both ports. so I cant see any fault at all with the USB ports they look immaculate and both take 20v and charge the battery,

I tried DFU revive but got the following errors half way through.
[ATTACH]60936[/ATTACH] [ATTACH]60937[/ATTACH]

I Have never worked on one of these before so any advice on where to start much appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check for short on all big coils of the board.
Don't forget L9080.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Before even removing the board, 
( Obvs no bat or power connected )
I get continuity beep to ground on both sides of

L7270
L7220
L7410
L7420

L9080 dosent short to ground,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Continuity beep is not equal short!
And not always only short is bad; lower value than normal may not beep, but may be bad.

CPU coils have low resistance to ground as normal.
You must check in ohm scale and compare with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Kinda knew this but just dont have another one of these boards to use as a comparison, Is there another method?

Does the Paul Daniels - flexbv contain this information?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: anything else I can do with this dude?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Any pulse on SSD and G3S voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
checking for pulse on ssd I checked 

<CAPACITOR>C9074</CAPACITOR> -12.57v solid

L9030 - 1.80v solid
L9020 -.908v solid
L9021 -.908v solid
L9080 -.2.51v solid
L9080 - 2.51v Solid
Not sure what else to check here?

ALL GS3 voltages are present and correct and solid

Measured with just charger no battery connected,.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Check for pulse on other coils; like RAM, PCH, CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Going over all the coils I can find.

Nothing pulses at all

L8410 - Starts at 30,0mV and slowly drops 
L8456 -5.1v solid
L7220 - 0v
L7270 - 0v
L8102 -0v
L8100 -0v

L7030 -9.80v solid
L7690 -3.23v solid
L7670 - 5.08v solid

I'm stumped.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
You should try DFU restore.
This will erase SSD...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Tried a few times,. Just get this each time 
[ATTACH]60947[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check for short on output power rails in page 74; like <SIGNAL>1V2_S3</SIGNAL>, etc...
If all good, then reflash <CHIP>U4770</CHIP> and try again DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Will check output rails shortly,

reflash <CHIP>U4770</CHIP> , This is a new one on me, presume this cant be done with medussa,?
I have a ch341A  does this do the correct voltage for this chip, and realistically how much of a ball ache is and what kind of success does it have? Im more tempted to hand this back as a no fix?>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
That is 1.8V SPI chip; use correct addapter for it.
Harald sells an adapter board which can be used.
